comments.text:
Microsoft gives you Visual Studio Express it's 100% free to use and with it 
you can developer Applications from start to deployment, 2nd you can 
partner with Microsoft for free giving you access to their full library of 
products, Word, Windows, Visual Studio for free for 5 years.
Microsoft loves giving out shit for free, including 4 phones and 1 tablet 
over the last 3 years for me, all the newest Lumia model.

Also Swift is not nuff said, that's like saying everyone loves Chocolate 
Cake equally, me personally I prefer a Danish. 

Microsoft supports Javascript, Jquery, HTML5, C#, C++ and VB.NET, if you 
can code, you can make something here!
And a personal though C# + XAML > Objective-C + Swift
comments.author: MegaNight

comments.text:
+MegaNight Dev Tools? Apple gives you Swift, 'Nuff said. 1) No, MS does not 
give everything away for free, nobody does. 2) If you really think 
"multiple supported languages" is a good thing, well, iOS supports 
Objective-C and Swift (or I guess JS in WebView). 3) I agree that Android 
development sucks. 4) Not a huge fan of eclipse…
comments.author: bjb2

comments.text:
+bjb2
Developer Tools?
That doesn't make any kind of sense, Microsoft gives you everything for 
free,  provides you with multiple supported languages and more 
documentation than one could use in a lifetime.
Unless you love PhoneGab and other such tools Android and iPhone is fucking 
horrible  to develop for, the Emulator alone for Android is slower than 
your average 1895 steam train.

Every phone has their ups and downs, but the developer tools are not one of 
the ups for iPhone compared to Windows Phone.
Also Eclipse man... Eclipse!!

captions.text:
In the beginning...there was light...and then...there
was app all knight.

Those days of wishing you were part cat part
lady bug are finally over! Fly Catbug Fly

finds you playing as Catbug from the awesome
YouTube show Bravest Warriors. You navigate

Catbug through different levels collecting
items like butter lettuce and sugar peas.

Drop your loot into portals that pop up so
you can get cash to upgrade your character.

Or spend it on outfits because who doesn’t
need a sombrero? Sombrero POWERRRR. The game

has zero in app purchases which is awesome
so all you have to worry about is avoiding
obstacles and cruising through the

Sky...Force. An incredibly good looking and
difficult arcade shooter where you spend most

your time blowing up enemies, sometimes in
slow motion, getting stars and decking out

your ship to better blow up said enemies.
But it isn’t all about destroying, oh no,

you also rescue helpless civilians. Get close
enough and then

Orbitum. Orbitum is a fast paced and dizzying
game. The rings and yourself get pulled towards

the black hole in the center and you have
to constantly jump to the outer circles to

avoid certain doom. Your orbiting speed changes
depending on the ring size and you have to

time your jumps to grab green orbs for points,
blue squares for power-ups and hyper jumps,

and avoid red triangles or else. It also has
a pretty killer soundtrack… And as we know

know when getting sucked into a black hole
your body stretches out do to spaghettification
and if you want that look, then get

Spring. Spring is a photo editing app with
one purpose. To take photos of you and elongate

your body. Ah yes, look at those magnificent
torsos. It is super simple to do and only
takes a

MinuteQuest. In this 2D side scrolling RPG
there are two directions - backwards and forwards.

And that is also the underlining theme of
the game. You begin the game, you battle,

level up, die, start from the beginning, battle,
level up, die and so on and so forth. But

the urge to level up your character and gain
new abilities and weapons is great.

Kiwanuka. At first it seems like a prettier
version of lemmings but it is much deeper

than that. Using your lightning spewing staff,
you create bridges out of your followers.

Push them in the direction they need to go
and then use their bodies as steps as you

work your way to free an imprisoned friend.
The puzzles can be difficult to figure out

as some actions have to be timed and certain
platforms break apart your bridge. Instead

of stringing people together, string words
together in

LEX. LEX is a word game and like most word
games, the more difficult the letter the more

points you score. However, you can’t just
leave some letters behind in favor of the

higher value ones. As the game progresses,
unused letters start to fill up and once completely

red, it is game over. The game makes you strategize
about which letters to use and when to use

them. But let me ask you a question: What
does the color purple sound like?

Well ROY G BIV says it sounds like this. ROY
G BIV is a synthesia synthesizer that uses

the saturation, brightness and hue of objects
to identify their color and adjust the synthesizers

musical variables. Allow me to regale you
in the sound of a bowl of pineapple. Now that
we’ve heard that sound, let’s go for a

Sound Ride. In this endless runner, there
are numerous obstacles to avoid and fun physics

to play with like bouncy floors, bridges to
help you jump and ones that fall, but one

of the coolest bits is building the background
song by hitting certain points in the level.

The game also has a really great look to it
but for a look that constantly changes there’s

my favorite app this episode, which will now
be called Appisode…

Monument Valley. If you have haven’t played
Monument Valley yet then you are probably

in a coma in which case “oooooo when you
wake up buy Jake endless amounts of Taco Bell”.

Monument Valley is really, really good. You
play as a princess who has to navigate through

different levels of a castle. Besides being
beautiful to look at, you have to literally

change your perspective to solve the puzzles.
The game plays with your sense of dimension

to create an experience that is based mainly
on illusions. It has a similar mechanic to

Fez which is definitely a good thing and every
aspect of the game, from the way it plays,
to it’s music and sound design is fantastic.

Links to all the apps can be found in the
description below.

title: Listen to Colors! -- App All Knight #21
